duties_responsibilities.duty: Inspect and maintain natural gas pipeline facilities including cathodic protection equipment, corrosion control systems, and pipeline integrity procedures.
Troubleshoot and perform repairs on rectifiers, ground-beds, and other corrosion control systems.
Ensure the safe, reliable, and efficient operation of natural gas pipeline facilities.
Work closely with pipeline/plant personnel, technicians, and contract personnel.
Ensure compliance with Company policies/procedures as well as external regulatory bodies.

education_certification.credential: Associate’s degree in a relevant technical field or related degree or equivalent education/experience.
Residence within 30 miles of the assigned reporting location.
Physical ability to perform demanding activities in all types of weather conditions.
Willingness to work overtime, weekends, be on call and standby, and travel overnight as required.
